Package: org.ysb33r.groovy.dsl.vfs

[Groovy] Class VFS

          Type Name and description

          A filter that selects only the direct children of the base folder.

          A filter that selects all the descendants of the base folder, but does not select the base folder itself.

          A filter that selects only files (not folders).

          A filter that selects only folders (not files).
          static FileSelector  select_all
          A filter that selects the base file/folder, plus all its descendants.
          static FileSelector  self_and_direct_children
          A filter that select the base plus its direct descendants

      • Constructor Detail

        • VFS(java.util.Map properties = [:], groovy.lang.Closure pluginLoader = null )

          Constructs a Virtual File System. During construction a number of properties can be passed to the underlying Apache VFS system.

        • cacheStrategy - Sets the cache strategy to use when dealing with file object data
        • defaultProvider - Default provider for unknown schemas
        • filesCache - Sets the file cache implementation
        • logger Sets the logger to use. Unlike the Apache VFS2 default behaviour, not providing this property, will turn off VFS logging completely
        • replicator - Sets the replicator
        • temporaryFileStore - Sets the temporary file store
        • ignoreDefaultProviders - Don't load any providers (overrides scanForVfsProviderXml, legacyPluginLoader)
        • scanForVfsProviderXml - Look for META-INF/vfs-provider.xml files
        • legacyPluginLoader - Load using providers.xml file from Apache VFS (implies scanForVfsProviderXml)

          In addition any global filesystem options can also be set vfs.FILESYSTEM.OPTION i.e. 'vfs.ftp.passiveMode' : true

          Parameters:
          properties - Default properties for initialising the system

      • Method Detail

        • FileContentEditor append(java.lang.Object uri)

          Appends content to a local or remote file object

          code:
          vfs.append 'file:///etc/resolv.conf' with 'Some text'
          endcode:
          Returns:
          Proxy object which will take a 'with' keyword

          Write content to a local or remote file object

          code:
          vfs.append 'file:///etc/resolv.conf', { strm -> strm << 'Some text' }
          endcode:
          Returns:
          Result of overwrite
          Parameters:
          uri

        • java.lang.Object cat(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object uri, groovy.lang.Closure c)

          vfs.cat ('file:///etc/resolv.conf') { strm -> println strm.text }
          endcode:

          properties - - Optional property map
          uri
          c - - Closure that takes an InputStream as argument

        • java.lang.Object cp(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object from, java.lang.Object to)

          Copies files.

          li:
          overwrite. Set to true to force overwrite of an existing target. Set to false, not to allow overwrites. Can also be a closure, in which case it needs to be of interface boolean(from,to).
          li:
          filter. A filter to select which file objects to copy. The filter is ignored if the source is a file.
          li:
          smash. Set to true, to replace an existing target file/directory with a source directory/file
          li:
          recursive. Used when source is a directory to indicate that directories should be copied recursively. Like -r/--recursive in POSIX cp. The following rules apply, if no filter is provided or if the source matches the provided filter
          From FileTypeTo FileType Overwrite? Smash? Recursive Action
          FILE IMAGINARYNo No- Copy (create file)
          FILE FILE No - - Don't copy
          FILE FILE Yes- - Overwrite file
          FILE FOLDER No No - If a same-named file does not exist in the folder, copy it, otherwise don't copy
          FILE FOLDER YesNo - Create same-named file in the folder, even it exists. If same-named directory exists, fail
          FILE FOLDER - Yes- Replace same-named folder with a filename
          FOLDERIMAGINARYNo No No Don't copy
          FOLDERIMAGINARYNo No YesCopy directory and descendants
          FOLDERFILE No No NoDon't copy
          FOLDERFILE YesNo NoDon't copy
          FOLDERFILE - Yes--Replace file with folder
          FOLDERFOLDER No No NoDon't copy
          FOLDERFOLDER No No YesCopy as a subfolder. Existing files will be skipped
          FOLDERFOLDER YesNo YesCopy as subfolder, replacing any same-named files along the way.
          FOLDERFOLDER -- Yes--Replace existing folder and its contents with the content of the source folder
          Parameters:
          from - URI to copy from. If source is a folder all descendants will be copied recursively. See filter property for selectively copying descendants
          to - URI to copy to. If destination is a folder, it will be placed inside folder. If destination is a file it will be replaced if overwrite property is true.
          properties

        • @groovy.transform.CompileDynamic java.lang.Object ls(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object uri, groovy.lang.Closure c)

          If used without a closure it will return an of VFS FileObject[]. If a closure is passed to it, then the closure will be called with a FileObject for each instance found

          li:
          filter A regex, closure of VFS FileSelector by which to select objects
          li:
          recursive If set to true will traverse down any subfolders. Ignored if filter is a FileSelector
          @code{ def vfs = new VFS() vfs.ls 'file:///usr/bin' vfs.ls ('file:///usr/bin') { println it.name } vfs.ls (filter: /^a.+/, 'file:///usr/bin') { println it.name } vfs.ls (recursive: true, filter: {}, 'file:///usr/bin') { } }
          Returns:
          If a closure is specified returns the results of passing each file to the provided closure, otherwise just return VFS FileObject[]
          Parameters:
          properties
          uri - URI pointing to area for which file listign is to be retrieved
          c - Closure that will be a single parameter (VFS FileObject)

        • java.lang.Object ls(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object uri)

          Parameters:
          uri

        • @groovy.transform.CompileDynamic java.lang.Object mkdir(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object uri)

          Creates a folder on any VFS that allows this functionality

          li:
          intermediates. Set to false if intermediate folders should not be created.
          Parameters:
          properties - Any additional vfs properties
          uri - Folder that needs to be created

        • long mtime(java.lang.Object uri)

          Returns the last modified time of a URI

          Returns:
          Number of seconds since epoch
          Parameters:
          uri
          Throws:
          FileSystemException if URI does not exist.

        • java.lang.Object mv(java.util.Map properties = [:], java.lang.Object from, java.lang.Object to)

          li:
          overwrite. Set to true to force overwrite of an existing target. Set to false, not to allow overwrites. Can also be a closure, in which case it needs to be of interface boolean(from,to).
          li:
          filter. A filter to select which file objects to copy. The filter is ignored if the source is a file.
          li:
          smash. Set to true, to replace an existing target file/directory with a source directory/file.
          li:
          intermediates. Default behaviour is to create non-existing intermediate subdirectories of target path. Set to 'false' if this behaviour is undesired. The following rules apply, if no filter is provided or if the source matches the provided filter
          From FileTypeTo FileType Overwrite? Smash? Action
          FILE IMAGINARYNo No Create new file, delete old file
          FILE FILE No No Don't move
          FILE FILE YesNo
          FILE FOLDER No No Move file into folder except if same-name target file exists
          FILE FOLDER YesNo Move file into folder, replacing any existing same-name target file
          FILE FOLDER - YesReplace fodler with file
          FOLDERIMAGINARYNo No Create new folder with content. Delete old folder
          FOLDERFILE No No Don't move
          FOLDERFILE YesNo Don't move
          FOLDERFILE - YesReplace file with folder
          FOLDERFOLDER No No Move folder as a sub-folder of destination. Fails if same-name target exists
          FOLDERFOLDER YesNo Move folder as a sub-folder of destination. Fails is same-name target exists and not empty.
          FOLDERFOLDER -- YesDelete old folder. Move source folder in place.
          Parameters:
          from - Source URI to move.
          to - Source URI to move to If destination is a file it will be replaced if overwrite property is true.
          properties

        • @groovy.transform.CompileDynamic java.lang.Object options(groovy.lang.Closure cfgDSL)

          Changes the default virtual file system options

          code:
          def vfs = new VFS() vfs.options 'vfs.ftp.passiveMode' : true vfs << { options { ftp { passiveMode true } } }
          endcode:

        • java.lang.Object options(java.util.Map properties = [:] )

          Changes the default virtual file system options

          code:
          def vfs = new VFS() vfs.options 'vfs.ftp.passiveMode' : true vfs << { options 'vfs.ftp.passiveMode' : true }
          endcode:
